item.title: General Python Setup
item.description: Install Python 3.8 What version of Python can I use? â†• By default, Ubuntu 18.04 comes with Python 3.6, however,for Vosk nshmyrev on GitHub recommends Python 3.8 Follow the article step by step: How to install Python 3.8 on Ubuntu 18.04 (Linuxize) To set Python 3.8.11 as the default simply add the following to the end of your Shell profile $ vim ~/.bashrc # ~/.bashrc alias python3="python3.8" $ source ~/.

item.title: Vosk Setup
item.description: Relevant Links Official Website Vosk API Vosk Server Set up Vosk as a system daemon We’ll set up Vosk as a daemon using systemd. In other words, we’ll configure Vosk to run on the VM in the background. Git & Vosk Server files $ cd $HOME $ git clone https://github.com/alphacep/vosk-server.git Install dependencies $ python3 -m pip install aiortc aiohttp aiorpc vosk $ python3 -m pip install websockets Download Speech Recognition model:
